availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Miller (Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and soldier.)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Native of Hesse-Kassel. Married to Matilda Miller. Father of Louis Miller, Emma Miller, Eddie Miller, and John Miller. Clerk in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Charged with theft in Louisville in 1861. Reported as a Union soldier killed at the Battle of Shiloh in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 104.
KYR-0001-029-0112.
